```{r, eval = TRUE}

derived_params = 
  {
    tibble(
      mu_y = input$mu_y |> exp(), 
      mu_b = input$mu_b |> exp(), 
      gamma = input$gamma |> exp(), 
      y0 = input$y0 |> exp(),
      b0 = input$b0 |> exp(),
      alpha = input$alpha |> exp(),
      rho = input$rho,
      t1 = t1f(
        mu_y = mu_y,
        mu_b = mu_b, 
        gamma = gamma, 
        y0 = y0,
        b0 = b0),
      y1 = y1f(y0 = input$y0 |> exp(), mu_y = mu_y, t1 = t1)
    ) 
  }|> reactive()



derived_params() |> renderTable(digits = 4)
```

```{r}

plot1 = 
  {
    ggplot() + 
      geom_function(
        fun = function(x) 
          antibody_decay_curve(
            t = x,
            mu_y = input$mu_y |> exp(), 
            mu_b = input$mu_b |> exp(), 
            gamma = input$gamma |> exp(), 
            y0 = input$y0 |> exp(),
            b0 = input$b0 |> exp(),
            alpha = input$alpha |> exp(),
            rho = input$rho
          ),
      ) + 
      xlim(0, 100) +
      # scale_x_log10(limits = c(.0001,100 |> log10())) +
      scale_y_continuous(
        limits = c(0, derived_params() |> pull(y1))
      )
  } |> reactive()

plot1() |> 
  plotly::ggplotly()  |>
  plotly::renderPlotly()
```
